brief:
Sets an orthographic projection and defines a parallel clipping
           volume
name: ortho()
description: Sets an orthographic projection and defines a parallel clipping volume. All objects with the same dimension appear the same size, regardless of whether they are near or far from the camera. The parameters to this function specify the clipping volume where left and right are the minimum and maximum x values, top and bottom are the minimum and maximum y values, and near and far are the minimum and maximum z values. If no parameters are given, the default is used: ortho(-width/2, width/2, -height/2, height/2).
syntax: ortho(left, right, bottom, top, near, far)

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: left plane of the clipping volume

parameters.name: right
parameters.description: right plane of the clipping volume

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.description: bottom plane of the clipping volume

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: top plane of the clipping volume

parameters.name: near
parameters.description: maximum distance from the origin to the viewer

parameters.name: far
parameters.description: maximum distance from the origin away from the viewer
